column5: It was rather mild in Red Lake this morning. Only -10F when we started work. Finished my 10 hours and battling a terrific cold right now. I'll do it all over again tomorrow, and for the next 10 days after that. Getting a little pumped about my DEWALT, Leafs, Phaneuf encounter two weeks from now. I'll be at the Bruins game.

Bass Talk at Whitby all day talk about Bass fishing over load, some of the Best Bass Fishermen in the Province including BIG JIM, Coffee, Donut's, Tim Bits, Bagels & Muffins for Starters, Pizza & Wings for lunch, then back to watch my Grand Daughters for the night & 2 of my FLW Fantasy guys are fishing tomorrow Bryan Thrift & Stetson Blaylock, hoping they are 1st & 2nd SBK
Well that is going on my list for tomorrow if I can get to the store,  escargots in garlic herb butter, makes for some good after supper toots
Apparently the spill is last nights accident that had the road closed 'till 4:30am. This mornings closure was strictly road conditions from what I can find on the North Bay Nugget reporting..
Been a long day indoors. 6 hours of pouring lead during the day andd just fininshed off another batch of salsa.
since the "crowd control weather" is back into effect ...ill hit the river in an hour or two...hope the sun comes out to keep the ice off the line..

Went through my tackle yesterday for the yearly clean up, then hit the bait shop for a quick chat and browse around Obviously I have to go back because I forgot something For today, I may just tie a few flies,streamers, yarn eggs, bucktail spinners

Helping Lew build the Ark, maybe we can fish off of it? 3pm Saturday it was in the 50`s rain all day and the snow was gone. By 11pm a sheet of ice and snow mix. There has been flood warning for all 88 counties in Ohio off and on all week.

Yes.. thats what I heard too Wayne. An officer told me there was a tractor with double trailers jack knifed on the hill at Tildon lake and other spun out on T-bone hill, but no accidents.. thankfully.  Did the papers report what the spill was??

Just got back from the river...it sucked...rain, snow, wind garbage!!! But I went, as my grandfather once told me 'you ain't gonna catch fish thinkin' about it' Now it's snowing and nasty out so all I can see to do is sit with my buddy's Carling L. and Napoleon and watch the day go by.. Cheers to all on a nasty March day!!!!
Working on my little outboard today. Wife has the flu so gotta stay close to home.  This is what  I started with.   And along the way.       Decals, touch ups and small parts to paint to do yet.
Bernie, you're amazing!

We went to the hut today. A little wet going out at 8 am really wet coming in at 1 pm. really thick fog too glad my hummingbird fishfinder has GPS. Real thick soup.  Lots of action whities were biting as far up as 20 feet of bottom in 80 ftw.  Can't wait till tomorrow.

aww that sucks. Ends up I'm in the same boat as you, figuratively of course.  I was on Nosbonsing going for pike, got a call from work and now I have to drive to pointe au baril ... oye, and I thought I was one of the lucky ones able to fish today.
A nice day off with the mrs,s.Hit Highland farms for supplies and BPS for some other supplies.Home now to relax til work Sunday.  Real purdy Bernie. Nice work.

Just back from simcoe.  Bad weather but lots of fish biting. Managed a 10.5 laker and an 8.8 pound laker. Lost another four fish and had another 3 bites on top of that.  Only fished until non.  Marking loads of fish and must have had at least 25 chasers today.
pics

I'm thinking of heading out for some fishing today. Might try and catch some Lings and learn how to cook em up, as we have never tried them before. I hear the river lings are not as tasty as great lakes version though?  Me and a pal went out last night to check the shack, we were thinking of moving it. And we found a hyyyuge crack about a 1000 feet long running right through our spots though, so I'm a little skeptical.  Going to play pool with the girl tonight though, other than that, I'll probably kill time making some lindy rigs etc. Maybe paint some homemade cranks I got in the works
I got some. They aren't the best because I was by myself and the lens fogged up a bunch but I will post them later.  Everything is drying out.
Tried to make a 4" hole in the side of my house today, ran into a large fastener and kibosed that idea. Now I will have to go through the top course of block instead
LOL.. won't take long to get rid of it Andy! Dang city parking and take out food.....

Shelly.. you still sitting there? You can probably see Lloyd's Grey van with U and ME on it from where you are. If the road's not going to open tonight....and you're stuck there... walk the ice road that starts beside the green fish hatchery building. 3 island out.. you'll find Lloyd. Terry may have made it.. Joey and Paul may be stuck South of town...

Bernie, nice restore!  Looks crisp!  As for me, just finished purchasing some books online, gonna read for a bit, clean, work with the animals, smoke, tie some flies.  Great relaxing day   Much needed.
What ya smoken? Chicken ,beef, pork?
7 minutes until twenty after four on my watch!

Made supper(sheppards pie) earlier this morning, then been trying all sorts of positions to gain some comfort, blasted lumbar disc took a slip on Thursday.    Now I know why they make shooz with velcro closers.  Can't even get into the car or truck to go spend money.

Well... 5 hours of adapting buddies trailer    to fit his new floats... took his cash and it's miller time!!! Pouring rain has now turned to snow for the last hour or more... glad I've got lots of mix and don't need to leave the property!
Time for chow,then a few drinks and then some Laugh out loud and then Randy Bachman's Vinyl Tap  WORK in the AM.

Was supposed to take the young lad snowboarding today....and was hoping we'd make a quick stop on Simcoe...but that all got washed down the drain.  So we hit up a little Laser Tag action, followed up by indoor go karts...worked out well. Now I'm feeling a mite nappish
Failed to mention,escargos and shrimp for snack later.

I'm sure I seen that Van Wayne..I'm outta there now..  I was right at the lake, the second truck in line when they closed the road.. dang, if I were only a few minutes sooner.. lol  They started letting north bound through long before they let south bound go because of Tilden Lake hill and T-Bone hill, no one could get up them... Thanks for that offer though, very much appreciated...  Very sad about that 87yr old lady in the Accident, and I sure hope that Dangerous goods load doesn't cause the area any trouble... They were only letting 1 lane through at a time when they finally let us go, because they were already digging up the area that took the spill... Let me know if you hear anything on that stuff would ya plz?  I hope the gang all made it safely...
Would you stop that teasing Brian.. I'm on my 3rd meal of soup... lol
cleaning fish

Now that is a good day   I'm suprised our company hasn't gotten the call on that spill...I'm working on one right now near P.O.B. Trucker landed 20 feet below the road in a swamp, 600 litres of diesel floating in the reeds....should be a fun cleanup. The driver was suprisingly ok. Take care out there L.Walleye.   Saltydog...that's what I wanted to be doing at this time! Good job, what did you catch?

As an optimistic fisherperson I ignored the weather warnings yesterday, but now that I see what's really going on out there I'm a little pesimistic about hitting the lake. Mostly it's the wind that's keeping me at bay.  Anyway, I'm just having a tea, watching sportscenter right now...poor gf has to work all day so I have a blank slate. I'll either suck it up and go fish, or stay in and be productive. Option B sounds like such a waste of time.
staying in... Unless Dutchy calls and wants to try ice fishing in the rain on a local pond today.
Racking wine and beer sounds like the plan...Maybe tie a couple fly's,who knows..
Finish ChrisK's new flyrod, start a couple of new rod builds and drink a few cold ones.
Spend some time with the family, finish my new "fishing area" in the basement...pray for one last shot at Simcoe next weekend
Waiting for a customer from White River.. with a trailer to load his floats onto and a big bag of cash !
Frankie, I'm serious here. We really NEED a whitefish to win the tournament...we can't do it without a whitefish...any size! PLEASE. I haven't any in my area. Have a great and safe time!

just got in from the shop there is 4" of water all around it I know because its built on 2X4's and the water is sitting right at the bottom of the plywood. Busy building baits and making parts for the lures to be assembled also taking a road trip to get some stuff for the Muskies Canada Odyssey. family day as we are all together.
I'll be making more baits and some more salsa.
At work now, but i may close early.Then gonna make some popcorn, cuddle up beside my honey and watch some flics in the theater room.
I was thinking about getting a hair cut but I just realized my coupon has expired....  I'm going to have to regroup and think this one over...

Almost finished the second bedroom down stairs, just a little finishing touches on the trim and hang the closet doors and I'm all done there. Hope to finish the floor in the downstairs kitchen perhaps today or tomorrow. Got a few hours work "work" to do then try to get all my tax stuff together. Believe me, I'd rather be fishing but not in the rain that they are calling for today.
The way the rain is coming down and the melting snow is coming up, I may just head out to the shop and build an arc
Just had a big family breakfast. I need to do some house cleaning and get the laundry done since I go back to work tomorrow...oh and finalize the details of my road trip to Philadelphia
A BIG BAG OF CASH???!!! I'll make sure I meet him at the gate.....
I hear you Roy!!!!!  Fingers crossed for good ice for one more week.
Hitting Superior in an hour! Chasing whities and jumbos!  TDunn
PM sent
Gonna sort some tackle, hit the gym. play mario kart with the kids, play guitar for a bit then going to The Marina Restaurant tonight.
Went out yesterday onto Simcoe with Roys huts out of beaverton, 2 lakers 2 whities caught. Today I am going to play hockey at Art Thompson arena.

im building a wagon for my son, so after looking outside, todays the perfect day to finish it then i think ill grab some cold ones and watch "the mechanic"...gotta love it when the wife and kid are away for the weekend
I'm gonna play squash,and a little shuffleboard after.

Great question .. I was thinking of walkin a trib today ( but on second thought better not until the flood passes ... option 2 ... I could go stand out on the melting ice in the wind and the rain .... BUT .... we already have a Whitey AND a Laker .... or  ... there are $400 of Le B. gift certificates ... calling out to be spent ... hmmm what to buy ... what to buy ??? Maybe one of those fancy PFD's ... or a fancy new reel ... hey wait .. I also have a couple from Bass Pro ...so i can actually shop around ... aint it fun having christmases and birthdays to celebrate all over and over again (who said gift certificates weren't a good idea)  ... heh I might even just window shop and get to enjoy the fun twice
Sitting in my Tractor, in bad weather, in yet another road closure, in Temagami, staring at the lake.. wishin I could just go fishin...
fishing on you tube is better than no fishing  <iframe title="YouTube video player" width="480" height="390" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/JLTJJ-lKOeI" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>
